safety_precautions: Always wear safety glasses when cutting or drilling wood
Use gloves when applying wood glue to avoid skin irritation
Ensure the chair is stable before starting the repair

steps.description: Remove the broken leg from the chair using the screwdriver or drill.
Measure the dimensions of the broken leg using the tape measure and cut the replacement wood to the same size with the saw.
Sand the edges of the new leg with sandpaper to ensure it is smooth.
Apply wood glue to the top of the new leg and attach it to the chair. Use clamps to hold it in place while the glue dries.
Once the glue has dried, reinforce the connection with wood screws using the drill.
Fill any gaps or holes with wood putty, allow it to dry, then sand smooth.

tips: Choose wood that matches the original chair for best aesthetic results
Ensure to measure twice before cutting the replacement leg
Allow sufficient time for the glue and putty to dry before moving the chair
